subject: Business
title: The Innovator's Dilemma
description: Learn The Innovator's Dilemma in one minute.

hook.text: Kodak invented the digital camera in 1975 â€” then buried it to protect film sales.

buildup.text: Clayton Christensen called this the innovator's dilemma: successful firms can't disrupt themselves.

discovery.text: Incumbents serve profitable customers with small improvements. Disruption starts in low-end niches.

twist.text: The disruptor's product is worse at first. Incumbents laugh â€” until the technology catches up.

climax.text: Netflix mailed DVDs while Blockbuster had 9,000 stores. Blockbuster is gone.

punchline.text: The biggest threat is the product you're too successful to build.

quiz.question: Why do incumbents often fail to adopt disruptive technology?
options: It threatens their profitable existing business
